paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the TTR gene variants, including penetrance data and individual case details.

patients.demographics: Portuguese ancestry, primarily from Northern Portugal

individual_records.phenotype_details: Polyneuropathy with loss of pain and temperature sensation
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The first symptoms appear at about 30 years of age.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Muscle weakness and paresis of feet and legs
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The survival time is highly variable but may be, on average, ten years from diagnosis.
Some individuals with the TTR mutation never develop the clinical characteristics associated with hATTR.
Autonomic failure with gastrointestinal symptoms is a common presentation.

functional_data.summary: The Val30Met mutation is known to affect TTR stability and aggregation.

variants.segregation_data: Yes, it segregates with disease in families.
variants.evidence_level: Moderate evidence based on familial segregation and clinical presentation.
variants.additional_notes: The Val30Met mutation is the most common variant associated with hATTR.
key_quotes: The most common mutation is the Val30Met substitution.
Some individuals with the TTR mutation never develop the clinical characteristics associated with hATTR.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text.
